intro: Brassica gracilis, commonly known as slender mustard, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like broccoli and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, alternate leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in racemes, and it produces small, rounded pods containing seeds. Brassica gracilis is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
